Paradigms.name: Object-oriented
Paradigms.details: Object-oriented programming (OOP) is a programming paradigm based on the concept of "objects"

Paradigms.name: Actor-based
Paradigms.details: The actor model in computer science is a mathematical model of concurrent computation that treats "actors" as the universal primitives of concurrent computation

Paradigms.name: Class-based
Paradigms.details: a style of object-oriented programming (OOP) in which inheritance is achieved by defining classes of objects

ProgrammingLanguages.name: Java
ProgrammingLanguages.details: Java is a general-purpose computer programming language that is concurrent, class-based, object-oriented,and specifically designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible

ProgrammingLanguages.name: Javascript
ProgrammingLanguages.details: a high-level, dynamic, untyped, and interpreted programming language
